<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 265, 222, 280]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 289, 296, 304]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[750, 289, 866, 304]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[725, 314, 866, 329]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 379, 355]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 365, 371, 380]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 397, 214, 412]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 413, 839, 603]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 632, 205, 647]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 648, 697, 678]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 69, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 138, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 69, 534, 87]]<|/det|>
Express \(16x^{2} - 24x + 10\) in the form \((4x + a)^{2} + b.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 69, 875, 87]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 485, 176, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 485, 848, 504]]<|/det|>
It is given that the equation \(16x^{2} - 24x + 10 = k\), where \(k\) is a constant, has exactly one root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 515, 353, 533]]<|/det|>
Find the value of this root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 515, 875, 533]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 89, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 71, 875, 102]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = (x - 3)\sqrt{x + 1} + 3\). The following points lie on the curve. Non-exact values are rounded to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 108, 801, 127]]<|/det|>
A \((2, k)\)  B \((2.9, 2.8025)\)  C \((2.99, 2.9800)\)  D \((2.999, 2.9980)\)  E \((3, 3)\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 146, 138, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 145, 568, 163]]<|/det|>
Find \(k\), giving your answer correct to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 146, 875, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 314, 141, 331]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 313, 698, 331]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of \(AE\), giving your answer correct to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 314, 875, 331]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 545, 875, 578]]<|/det|>
The gradients of \(BE\), \(CE\) and \(DE\), rounded to 4 decimal places, are 1.9748, 1.9975 and 1.9997 respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 590, 139, 607]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 588, 875, 621]]<|/det|>
State, giving a reason for your answer, what the values of the four gradients suggest about the gradient of the curve at the point \(E\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 603, 875, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 70, 875, 103]]<|/det|>
Points \(A\) and \(B\) have coordinates (8, 3) and \((p, q)\) respectively. The equation of the perpendicular bisector of \(AB\) is \(y = -2x + 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 113, 316, 131]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 113, 876, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 70, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 875, 107]]<|/det|>
The point \(A\) has coordinates (1, 5) and the line \(l\) has gradient \(- \frac{2}{3}\) and passes through \(A\). A circle has centre (5, 11) and radius \(\sqrt{52}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 116, 138, 134]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 116, 479, 135]]<|/det|>
Show that \(l\) is the tangent to the circle at \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 116, 875, 134]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 504, 176, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 504, 798, 522]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the other circle of radius \(\sqrt{52}\) for which \(l\) is also the tangent at \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 504, 875, 522]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 69, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[232, 81, 757, 260]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 278, 875, 312]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve with equation \(y^{2} = x - 2\) and the lines \(x = 5\) and \(y = 1\). The shaded region enclosed by the curve and the lines is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 323, 311, 341]]<|/det|>
Find the volume obtained.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 323, 876, 341]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 75, 141, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 72, 287, 92]]<|/det|>
Prove the identity

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 67, 524, 100]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1 + \sin x}{1 - \sin x} - \frac{1 - \sin x}{1 + \sin x} \equiv \frac{4\tan x}{\cos x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 73, 876, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 75, 141, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 71, 230, 102]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 76, 876, 95]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 504, 181, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 581, 523]]<|/det|>
Determine the nature of the stationary point at (2, \(-3.5\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 504, 876, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 99, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 82, 640, 282]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 297, 876, 348]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a cross-section of seven cylindrical pipes, each of radius \(20\mathrm{cm}\), held together by a thin rope which is wrapped tightly around the pipes. The centres of the six outer pipes are \(A, B, C, D, E\) and \(F\). Points \(P\) and \(Q\) are situated where straight sections of the rope meet the pipe with centre \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 359, 141, 377]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 359, 420, 377]]<|/det|>
Show that angle \(PAQ = \frac{1}{3}\pi\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 359, 875, 377]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 592, 358, 610]]<|/det|>
Find the length of the rope.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 592, 876, 610]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
